metadata.name: Potential Network Sniffing Activity Using Network Tools
metadata.comment: Detects potential network sniffing via use of network tools such as "tshark", "windump". Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\tshark.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-i')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\windump.exe'))))
